author: Kate Morris and Sally Brown
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. Line a baking tray with greaseproof paper. Rub the flour and butter together in a bowl until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Stir in the chives and feta. Add the milk and stir together to form a dough. Tip the dough out onto a floured work surface and roll out to a thickness of 0.5cm/¼ in thickness. Using a biscuit cutter, cut out shapes and place onto the baking tray. Re-roll any leftover dough to make more biscuits. Bake in the oven for 8–10 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown.
ingredients: 100g/3½oz self-raising flour,  25g/1oz soft butter,  1 tsp chopped chives,  25g/1oz feta, crumbled,  50ml/2fl oz whole milk
